body_html:
@wangdongxuking61 We have some evidence that it is fixed in master. Would you mind doing a build of PyTorch master and seeing if it still has the problem? That would help a lot!

That's true, my tests indicated that the errors went away when I ran with a relatively recent version of Pytorch master (almost top of tree but not quite). And dataloader.py pulls in utilities from other files as well, which may have been updated.

I provided instructions in my last post for how to build a container with the most recent Pytorch master, without having to manually install NCCL or CuDNN (@ezyang probably knows better than I do though, so please correct me if there is an easier/more canonical way to do this)
body:
> @wangdongxuking61 We have some evidence that it is fixed in master. Would you mind doing a build of PyTorch master and seeing if it still has the problem? That would help a lot!

That's true, my tests indicated that the errors went away when I ran with a relatively recent version of Pytorch master (almost top of tree but not quite).  And dataloader.py pulls in utilities from other files as well, which may have been updated.  

I provided instructions in [my last post](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/11327#issuecomment-421402529) for how to build a container with the most recent Pytorch master, without having to manually install NCCL or CuDNN (@ezyang probably knows better than I do though, so please correct me if there is an easier/more canonical way to do this)
